location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in Bushire, to Shaikh Abdoola bin Ahmed

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from insect damage and is difficult to read in places as parts of the text are missing.Foliation: This item has two different foliation sequences. The first is part of an original foliation sequence which was applied to the whole volume. It is written in ink and appears at the top right corner of the page. The second foliation number is a small pencil number enclosed in a circle which also appears in the top right corner, this is the foliation number that has been used in referencing this item.

mods.abstract: The letter relates to a misunderstanding between Shaikh Abdoola and Shaikh Tanoon [Ṭaḥnūn bin Shakhbūṭ Āl Nahyān] and the result of Stannus's enquiries. It refers to Soocedan bin Sal's asylum with Shaikh Abdoola following his flight from Abothabee [Abu Dhabi] to escape creditors, and his seizure of several boats for his followers, with some violence. It describes Shaikh Tanoon's pursuit and recapture of two boats and the capture of a bugla [boat] and an escape. Stannus requests the return of the boats taken by Soocedan, the bugla taken by his followers, and the removal of Soocedan from his territories.
